item.title: Trump Says He Will Postpone G-7 Meeting to Fall
item.description: President Trump said he wants to postpone the next Group of Seven nations meeting until the fall, and is looking to include additional countries.

item.title: Russia Approves Flu Drug's Use Against Covid-19
item.description: Russia’s Ministry of Health on Saturday approved a flu drug for use in fighting coronavirus after officials said preliminary testing showed hospitalized patients who took the pills recovered more quickly.

item.title: Release Sought for Kidnapped Mali Opposition Leader
item.description: Soumaïla Cissé was taken amid a surge of killings and kidnappings during a detente between al Qaeda and Islamic State in West Africa.

item.title: Trump's Policy Changes on China Likely to Draw Pushback
item.description: President Trump’s recent moves to punish China over its treatment of Hong Kong and other issues are likely to harden Beijing’s resolve to push back.

item.title: A Mayor Fights Covid-19 With Free Food as Colombia Faces Rising Toll
item.description: As Latin America becomes a new center of the pandemic, the mayor of Soacha, Colombia, is fighting Covid-19 with extensive food handouts amid a stringent lockdown. The city of one million has had only four deaths, but residents are chafing against restrictions on movement.

item.title: Beyond Hong Kong, an Emboldened Xi Jinping Pushes the Boundaries
item.description: With the U.S. and its allies distracted by the pandemic, China’s leader has taken bold steps on issues where he’s often faced international pushback, including Taiwan, the South China Sea and a disputed border with India.
